title: Ticket #7383: condor_submit should set an attr if the user specified getenv=true
description:
We want to warn and/or disallow users from using getenv=true (because in a grid environment it's almost always the wrong thing to do, and results in pain and suffering).

The most elegant way we can think of to do this is to use a transform which checks for it, and rejects the job with a nice error message at submit time.

However, I believe getenv=true is a submit file command which modifies the environment attr in the job ad, but does not result in any clear evidence classad evidence that it was specified.

If Condor could set used_getenv=true or something in the job ad, we could do it.

Alternatively, Condor could implement a first-class feature to disable getenv=true, but we're happy to use a transform, and this seems like a trivial change on your end.
remarks:
2019-Nov-15 15:53:22 by pfc:
When this is done, we need to implement the job transform on the IGWN side: https://github.com/lscsoft/osg-igwn/issues/129

2019-Nov-18 10:31:38 by gthain:
We'd prefer a submit-side knob to make getenv=true an error, if that's OK with IGWN.

2019-Dec-03 10:56:57 by gthain:
Note that a clever use can override this condor_submit knob (or any submit side knob) with an environment variable, e.g. 

_condor_SUBMIT_ALLOW_GETENV=true condor_submit my_submit_file
